column4: i have a dual screen configuration, when i use virtualbox in fullscreen, and then click on the other screen, the panels appear over virtualbox. Is it possible to disable this behaviour?
there's a option to use "full screen" in Vbox.. that should remove the borders i do believe
thats the option im using
i thinkt he reslution is out of range for that service.
nevermind, it works
so before you open vbox, are your panels on the other display?
well, it looks like the issue is that top panel on the right screen... move it to the right.
you mean permanently? i dont want to reallly. the problem is bearable, just inconvinent, the main problem is the bottom panel becusae it covers the windows panel (the vbox)
just want to make sure i understand... do the panels "switch" from the left monitor to the right monitor, when you go full screen?

the panels dont move, when vbox is focused, then it looks like a standard windows desktop, with ubuntu on my left screen, but when i click anything on the left screen, the panels appear above vbox on the right screen. vbox isnt doing fullscreen properly
i see.. is the "right" monitor set as default display?... (i use nvidia-settings.. don't know how to do it w/ ATI)
i dunno.. it works fine for me(but i only run one panel)... http://imagebin.org/130211
looks the same... hang on, i'll show you
if you look, my trashcan is clicked on that shot.
um, 3.2 i think
yeah, i really don't know.. it works fine for me.
yes,
i flashed it out a little, but yes.
i dunno... i've used this system on Ubuntu as well, and i don't see the issue you're having
it's not bad. but it's not nearly as user friendly as Ubuntu..
lol, well just be forewarned, they are  bit on the "pricK" side in #debian
it's not written in stone like Ubuntu... but usually close to 8-12mo
sounds good, im downloading it now to try out in vbox, if it does everything i need, ill probably install it before i go back to school.
